intro: Justicia triflora, commonly known as the three-flowered false arum, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm. The plant features striking, arrow-shaped leaves with a dark green upper surface and a lighter underside. Its flowers are small, clustered in spikes, and often have a distinctive purple or reddish hue. Justicia triflora thrives in moist, well-drained soil and is often found in shaded to semi-shaded environments.
